alert.note: Alert for City of Norton; Wise (Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 06 at 4:21PM EDT until July 06 at 11:00PM EDT by NWS Knoxville
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 615 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southwest Virginia, including the following county and independent city, City of Norton and Wise. * WHEN...Until 615 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Water over roadways. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 421 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated heavy rain due to thunderstorms in the last 2 hours. Only light rain was falling in the area now. This may continue to cause small stream flooding. Between 1 and 2 inches of rain have fallen. - Additional rainfall amounts of up to 0.5 inches is possible over the area. This additional rain may result in minor flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Norton, Wise, Coeburn, Pound and Pardee. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be aware of your surroundings and do not drive on flooded roads. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
